channel.title: Posts on cs1010: Computing for Future Leaders
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on cs1010: Computing for Future Leaders

item.title: Class 8: The Internet and the World Wide Web
item.description: Schedule The first part of Project 2 is due on Monday, 19 February (the full submission is due on Friday, 23 February). Everyone is strongly encouraged to get started on Project 2 soon so you can ask questions about any problems you run into in class Thursday. Links Live map of Starlink Satellites Vannevar Bush, As We May Think, Atlantic Monthly, July 1945. Tim Berners-Lee, Information Management: A Proposal, 1989. Slides Class 8: The Internet and the World Wide Web.

item.title: The Most Awesome Websites Ever!
item.description: This post has links to some of the most awesome websites ever created, and we hope you and any crawler that happens to visit this page will enjoy them! Watermelons and Capybaras

item.title: Class 7: Finding Needles on the Web
item.description: Slides The slides are here: Class 7: Finding Needles on the Web. ChatGPT is not a search engine: “hallucinating” UVA classes Search Strategies Jefferson’s Library (see Catalogue of the Library of Thomas Jefferson) Index Hashing Grading Philosophy

item.title: Class 6: Search
item.description: Slides The slides are here: Class 6: Search. Right-to-left and left-to-right text How computers encode text Unicode Possible Paths for the Course Search Engine Trivia Contest! Introducing Web Search

item.title: Class 5: Computing on Binary Data

item.title: Class 4: Continuous Binary Representations
item.description: Charge Project 1 is due at the beginning of class on Thursday, 1 February 2024. The news discussions are now on a two-week cycle. There is a new discussion post in Canvas, and an expectation that everyone makes a valuable contribution sometime before 9 February. Slides The slides are here: Class 4: Continuous Binary Representations. Project 1 Questions Continuous Binary Representations Encryption Leaking DRAM (Cold Boot Attacks)

item.title: Class 3: Apple is Lossy, but Microsoft has bigger Megabytes
item.description: Charge Project 1 is due at the beginning of class on Thursday, 1 February 2024. Slides The slides are here: Apple is Lossy, but Microsoft has bigger Megabytes. 16 bits What’s a “MB”? Data Compression Why Binary? Songs Here are the different versions of [Wildest Dreams]: WAV file - 38,891,789 bytes High Qualify mp3 - 7,351,137 bytes 128 kbps mp3 - 3,528,681 bytes 64 kbps mp3 - 1,764,475 bytes 32 kbps mp3 - 882,477 bytes I think everyone will hear something wrong with the smallest (32 kbps) version, but try the other ones to see if you can hear the difference between the 1.

item.title: Class 2: The Digital Abstraction
item.description: Charge Project 1 is now posted, and is due at the beginning of class on Thursday, 1 February 2024. Slides The slides are here: Class 2: The Digital Abstraction. Beginning of Course Survey Analog/Digital Digital Music

item.title: Class 1: Introduction
item.description: Charge Before 8:59pm Friday (Jan 19), read the syllabus and submit the Beginning of Course Survey. Sometime next week (but earlier is better), contribute to the Computing in the News Week 1 discussion. Slides The slides are here: Class 1: Introduction. Course Objectives Why do we need to understand computing? Expectations What are we curious about Who am I and why am I teaching this course Introducting Digital vs. Analog

item.title: Starting this week
item.description: Welcome back! The semester starts this week and our first class meeting will be on Thursday, January 18 (11:00am in Olsson Hall 009). A near-final version of the Syllabus is now posted. We’ll talk about the plan for the course in the first class Thursday, but feel free to reach out to me with any questions or concerns you have. If you want to get an early start on the class, please fill out the Beginning of Course Survey (which is due at 6:59pm Friday).

item.title: Welcome to cs1010!
item.description: Welcome to cs1010! This is the public course website for UVA’s cs1010 Spring 2024 course. Our first class meeting will be on Thursday, January 18 (11:00am in Olsson Hall 009). More material will be posted here as the beginning of the semester approaches.
